intro: Hymenanthes californica, commonly known as the California hazelnut, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a woody husk, which ripen in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and woodlands. Hymenanthes californica plays an important ecological role by providing food for wildlife and supporting local biodiversity.
